body: This release fixes an accessibility issue with the tabs component.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Removed up and down arrow key listeners from tabs component

body: This release fixes bugs related to the header, modal, table, and loading indicator components.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Fixed missing top border from .rvt-table-cells columns
Updated loading indicator margin to center XXS indicator in small button
Fixed error when Modal.open or Modal.close is called on a modal that has been removed from the DOM
Removed role="menu" from header examples and instance

body: This release adds border removal utility classes and fixes bugs related to the button, dropdown, and collapsible components.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Added border removal utility classes
Updated button focus outline color to match border/fill color
Added toggle variable check to dropdown component JS
Updated readme and contributing files for Q1 2021
Converted utilities .hbs files to .njk
Added passing automated tests for calling API methods on removed dropdowns

body: This release fixes some small styling issues, improves accessibility, and refactors JavaScript syntax.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Replaced aria-describedby with aria-hidden
Fixed header drawer bottom border issue
Updated disabled loading indicator button styles
Refactored _handleBackwardTab function
Fixed backward tabbing issue for modals

body: This release refines several styles related to badges as well as other improvements.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Updated loading indicator to calculate the appropriate border-width
Darkened background on disabled checked radio inputs
Adjusted badge styles to align with Rivet sizes
Removed border-top for first-child of rows within a box
Fixed dropdown toggling when disabled issue

body: This release introduces the timeline component as well as a few bug fixes and improvements.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Added new Timeline component
Updated focus for input groups
Incorporated stylelint-config-rivet package

body: Rivet 1.6.0 is now available. This release introduces the step indicator and menu components along with a Rivet icons add-on.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Deprecated bp() Sass function in favor of $breakpoint variables
Added new step indicator component
Added new menu component
Incorporated Rivet eslint standard

body: This release introduces responsive width utility classes, squashes a few bugs, and updates our build process.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Added responsive width utility classes
Incorporated Circle CI into build process
Fixed breakpoints for new footer lockup
Fixed active state background color for small secondary button

body: This release makes some updates to the Rivet footer and deprecates classes related to alerts and the loading indicator.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Added optional alert dismissal data selector
Deprecated variable color-subtle-gray
Deprecated footer copyright markup element
Updated footer to reflect new IU standards for link order and text
Updated button loading indicator markup to be clear that it works with text and icons

body: This release includes a handful of bug fixes as well as new set of responsive flexbox utility classes.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Replaced all static numbers for font weight to use variables
Added none alias to spacing classes
Fixed bug where Dropdown close method broke when dropdown no longer existed
Fixed bug where Drawer javascript was interfering keyboard functionality of some types of form inputs
Fixed bug where generic aria-controls selector could potentially interfere with other scripts
Added new flexbox utility classes

body: This release fixes a bug in the modal JavaScript where using a modal without a corresponding modal trigger would throw errors.<!-- end-overview -->

items.title: Fixed issue where modal open and close methods where throwing console errors when used with out a modal trigger button

body:
This new version of Rivet includes a few requested components and various improvements.

## Feature additions
In this release we've added new Box, Media object, and Loading indicator components.

## Bug fixes
We've also fixed a number of bugs, typos, and misspellings.

items.title: Improved consistency of color variables and usage
Added new media object component
Added new Box component
Added new loading indicator component
Changed breakpoint variables from px to em
Fixed search input height issue

body:
This is the official release of Rivet 1.1.0

## Feature additions
This release fixes a lot of JavaScript-related issues, adds several new utility classes, and provides additional variations of the table component.

## Bug fixes
We spent a lot of time fixing issues related to JavaScript event listeners from previous versions of Rivet.

items.title: Refactored Drawer JavaScript to use event delegation
items.body:
This pull request refactors the Drawer JavaScript to use event delegation to handle interaction. This will make it so that once the Drawer is initialized new elements can be added to and removed from the DOM and it will not require any kind of reinitialization.

- New `open()` and `close()` methods with optional callbacks
- New `destroy()` method
- New custom `drawerOpen` and `drawerClose` events
- Added support for keyboard navigation within the drawer

This should fix a lot of the same issue related to updating the DOM after initialization. It also adds a couple of new public API methods to make the drawer easier to work with.

I'm working on revised tests now, but wanted to get this started since it's kind of a big one.

items.title: Added new type scale aliases
items.body:
This PR adds new aliases for a handful of type scale size that map to more semantic sizing language we use elsewhere in Rivet. e.g. `xxs`, `xs`, `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `xl`, `xxl`.

- Added new aliases to main `$type-sizes` Sass map so that utility classes get generated
- Added new aliases as Sass variables as well E.g `$ts-md` is the equivalent of `$ts-26`, and so on
- Updated example `.hbs` file to show alias CSS classes in the type scale table
- Did some general clean up to standardize the spacing between each group of variable declarations in the main `_variables.scss` file

items.title: Refactored Modal JavaScript to use event delegation
items.body:
This pull request refactors the Modal JavaScript to use event delegation to handle interaction. This will make it so that once the Modal is initialized new elements can be added to and removed from the DOM and it will not require any kind of reinitialization.

- New optional callbacks for open and close methods
- New custom `modalOpen` and `modalClose` events
- New `focusModal` method for programmatically moving focus to the active modal
- New `focusTrigger` method for programmatically moving focus back to the active modal trigger

NOTE: This refactor _does_ introduce a change in the API of the Modal's `.open()` and  `.close()` methods. Instead of accepting a `HTMLElement` i.e. the result of `.querySelector('#my-modal')` both `.open()` and `.close()` only need to be passed a string that corresponds to the Modal's `id` and the modal triggers `data-modal-trigger` attributes. We'll need to make sure to note this change in the blog post for the release as well as the release notes.

items.title: Refactored Tabs JavaScript to use event delegation
items.body:
This pull request refactors the tabs JavaScript to use event delegation to handle interaction. This will make it so that once the tabs script is initialized new elements can be added to and removed from the DOM and it will not require any kind of reinitialization.

- Rewrote script so that it uses a `data-tab` attribute as a selector hook instead of `aria-controls`. `aria-controls` will still work for those who have already have tabs in their app, but we'll updated the docs to use `data-tab` moving forward.
- Refactored event handlers so that they don't rely on any CSS classes. Now all JavaScript selector hooks are totally separate from all styling. This will make it easy create other versions of the tabs, for instance the additional version discussed in #342 
- Added new `activateTab` method that can be used to switch tabs programmatically

@jolamar Tagged you for a review since you had done some work on the original version.

items.title: Added vertical and horizontal spacing utility classes
items.body:
Added: 
- `.rvt-m-tb-`: Top and bottom margin
- `.rvt-m-lr-`: Left and right margin
- `.rvt-p-tb-`: Top and bottom padding
- `.rvt-p-lr-`: Left and right padding

Addresses issue #179.

items.title: Added utility class for full-width buttons
items.body:
Added `.rvt-button--full-width` utility class for buttons that fill the width of their container.

Addresses issue #99.

items.title: Refactored File Input JavaScript to use event delegation
items.body: This pull request refactors the file input JavaScript to use event delegation to handle interaction. This will make it so that once the file input script is initialized new elements can be added to and removed from the DOM and it will not require any kind of reinitialization.

items.title: Add support for nesting dropdowns in a segmented button
Added new compact and cells table variant
items.body: This PR adds two new table variants that called `.rvt-table-compact` and `.rvt-table-cells`. This is based on the requests outlined in #329.

items.title: Refactored Dropdown JavaScript to use event delegation
items.body:
This pull request refactors the Dropdown JavaScript to use event delegation to handle interaction. This will make it so that once the Dropdown is initialized new elements can be added to and removed from the DOM and it will not require any kind of reinitialization.

Some other new features:
- Refactored the `toggle()` method into tow separate methods (`open()` and `close()`)
- Removed the `closeAll()` method in favor of open and close methods that should have better performance 
- Added custom events `dropdownOpen` and `dropdownClose` that get fired when `open()` and `close()` are fired respectively
- Added optional callbacks to `open()` and `close()` methods

I've updated all the tests and they are passing. Would love some feedback. I've also created a test case here where you can press the "n" key to add a new dropdown to the DOM and see that everything still works fine, including the dynamically added dropdown.

items.title: Added CSS for disabled file inputs
Added SASS variables for global breakpoints
Added rvt-link--bold for bold links without an underline
Fixed incorrect usage of aria attributes in header markup
Fixed typo in .rvt-link--reverse CSS class
items.body:
fixes #285

.rvt-link-reverse was left in place to avoid creating a breaking change, but should be deprecated in a later release

items.title: Added the .rvt-text-nobr utility class to prevent text from breaking onto a new line
items.body: Added utility class to prevent text from breaking onto a new line

items.title: Added !default to every SASS variable to prevent overriding previously set variables
Fixed issue where missing IE compatibility tag was causing JavaScript issues in some browsers
items.body: Added IE compatibility mode meta tag

items.title: Standardized the way we use color names across components
items.body:
This PR addresses #295 

Here's an updated table to show how alert, badge, button, and form validation (both input validation and validation messages) class names have been standardized.

One big change to note is that I've removed the one-off alert blue color that is currently used for `--info` type alerts. Informational alerts will now use tints of the primary Blue/Midnight color used for default buttons, links, etc. I think eliminating this one color that is only used in this one specific situation will help simplify things a bit and help further standardize and make more consistent the way we refer to color across components.

| Color       | Button    | Badge   | Form Validation | Alerts    |
| ---------- | --------- | --------- | ----------------- | --------- |
| Gray         | * N/A       | default  | * N/A | default       |
| Dark Blue | default (referred to as Primary) | `--info`    | `--info`, `-validation-info` | `--info` |
| ~~Blue~~         | ~~N/A~~       | ~~N/A~~        | ~~has-info~~ | ~~info~~ |
| Green      | `--success`  | `--success`, `--success-secondary`  | `--success`, `-validation-success` | `--success`  |
| Yellow      | * N/A       | `--warning`, `--warning-secondary` | `--warning`, `-validation-success` | `--warning` |
| Red          | `--danger`  | `--danger`, `--danger-secondary` | `--danger`, `-validation-danger` | `--danger` |
| White      | plain      | * N/A       | * N/A  | * N/A  |

"*" I left these "N/A" cells unaddressed for now. Not sure about introducing new button styles/variants here. I'm not apposed at all to carrying these variants throught to the cells marked "N/A", but that may just be out of the scope of this PR and not sure that it even makes sense in some cases—for instance the White/Plain buttons. That wouldn't really make sense to carry through to form inputs, alerts, etc. It's more of a button-specific variant.

@jawbenne tagging you for a review here since you opened the original issue. Happy to hear and suggestions or talk through any of this stuff.

body:
This is the official release of Rivet 1.0.0 🎉 

## Feature additions
 Major feature additions include new styles for indicating the current page in the header main navigation, improved documentation for dropdown accessibility and markup, and various improvements to CSS and visual design. 

## Bug fixes
 This release also fixes a few visual inconsistencies including link focus state, small buttons, and modal controls on smaller screens.

items.title: Fixed custom radio buttons and checkboxes so that it's possible to use adjacent hidden inputs in forms
Updated link focus state to slightly offset the outline making focused links more legible
Improved aria semantics on dropdown menus
Added new current indicator for main navigation in header
Fixed bug where modal controls display would break on smaller screens
Fixed display issues caused by small button line-height
